title: 115_hr2185
content: The Act is titled the "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act." It involves determining if certain foreign financial institutions have facilitated transactions for covered persons. The "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" requires the President to determine if foreign financial institutions have knowingly facilitated significant transactions for covered persons listed in specific attachments. Certifications must be submitted to congressional committees in unclassified form, with the possibility of a classified annex. The certification described in subsection (a)(2) must be submitted in unclassified form, with the option of a classified annex. Transactions and financial services deemed significant are determined according to section 561.404 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. SEC. 3 of the Act requires the President to determine if foreign persons listed in specific attachments have supported certain individuals and report to Congress every 180 days. The determination must be in unclassified form but may include a classified annex. A person described in this section is an organization designated as a foreign terrorist organization by the Secretary of State or a foreign person whose property is blocked under various Executive Orders related to terrorism and weapons of mass destruction proliferation. Executive Orders related to blocking property and prohibiting exports to Syria include 12938, 13338, 13399, 13460, 13572, and 13573 targeting persons involved in human rights abuses and senior officials of the Syrian government. Executive Orders 13573, 13582, 13608, 13606, and 13553 target blocking property and prohibiting transactions with Syria and Iran for human rights abuses. The text chunk discusses the blocking of property and interests in property of certain Iranian persons and entities, including Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps, under Executive Order 13553. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, definitions include terms such as "appropriate congressional committees," "foreign financial institution," and "foreign person," with specific meanings provided for each term. The Act defines terms like "foreign terrorist organization," "Iranian financial institution," and "Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action." The Comprehensive Plan of Action, agreed to in Vienna on July 14, 2015, by Iran and several other countries, along with all related implementing materials and agreements, was transmitted to Congress on July 19, 2015. The terms "person" and "United States person" are defined in relation to the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996.
